title: Authors and Citation
text: Kai Aragaki. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Aragaki K (2021). gp: Grammer Plates. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://kaiaragaki.github.io/gp/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gp: A Grammer of Plates},   author = {Kai Aragaki},   year = {2021},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://kaiaragaki.github.io/gp/}, }

title: A Grammer of Plates
text: gp package meant provide introduce grammar plates. Microwell plates usually arranged visually meaningful ways tidy data, manipulation tidy form (back) uniquely cumbersome. package aimed developers create packages ingest produce plate data well interactive use.

title: A Grammer of Plates
text: can install development version GitHub :

title: A Grammer of Plates
text: Creating plate plot simple: can add rectangular ‘sections’ plates:  sections can sections well. KAINOTE(Easier understand example )  gp also theme - gp_mini_theme - lets create sparkline-esque plates. align primers columns
code: library(gp) gp(rows = 8, cols = 16) |>   gp_plot(row) gp(rows = 16, cols = 24) |>    gp_sec("my_section", nrow = 12, ncol = 6, start_corner = "tl", flow = "row") |>    gp_plot(my_section) gp(rows = 16, cols = 24) |>    gp_sec("my_section", nrow = 12, ncol = 6, start_corner = "tl", flow = "row") |>    gp_sec("secsec", nrow = 3, ncol = 3, start_corner = "tl", flow = "col") |>    gp_plot(secsec) mini_plot <- gp(8, 12) |>    gp_sec(name = "primers", ncol = 3) |>    gp_plot(primers) +    gp_mini_theme() ggplot2::ggsave(filename = "./man/figures/mini-plot.png",                  plot = mini_plot,                 height = 0.5,                  width = 0.75,                  units = "in",                  scale = 3.5)

title: A Grammer of Plates
text: two axes defining plates: rows columns row: absolute row plate, starting top plate. axis corresponds closely physical plate. col: absolute column plate, starting left plate. axis corresponds closely physical plate.

title: A Grammer of Plates
text: axes can modifier(s) appended name, like: sec: section. axis number given section. rel: relative. flips axes starting corner now (1, 1) par: parent. indicates whether sec refers current section parent section. par appear without sec, sec can appear without par. Order important. fully loaded column look like row_sec_par_rel. KAINOTE(columns ?)

title: A Grammer of Plates
text: section rectangular field wells. plate section - largest section. Sections can sections - child sections. sections except plate parent sections. Sections must - - size parent section. writing, sections must size, likely change. Sections can attributes: padding margin

title: A Grammer of Plates
text: lane used define grid sections, usually one well wide (otherwise just row column). lanes used define sections wrap = FALSE. wrap = TRUE, sections allowed flow edge specified direction (flow = "row" flow = "col") continue next line.

title: A Grammer of Plates
text: wrap = TRUE needs put stuff . probably JUST margin simplicity sake. Real plotting functions. Also miniplotting function inline plotting (la sparklines) pkgdown update hex Allow user supply vector rows/cols section definition Data layering? Need think best .

title: An S4 class to represent microwell plate data — Plate-class
text: x Plate object. n optional, character name numeric position layer access position layer position add modify value numeric. Number wells set. positions numeric character vector specifying positions names layers removed. negate logical. TRUE, values kept instead removed.

title: An S4 class to represent microwell plate data — Plate-class
text: layers: accessor plate layers layers<-: add/overwrite plate layer spill: Alternative cuter method access layers scrape: remove (keep) layers character numeric vector. serve: method convert plate object tidy tibble wells: access number wells plate. wells<-: set well number plate object.

title: An S4 class to represent microwell plate data — Plate-class
text: layers list matrices meta named list characteristics refer whole plate wells numeric describes many wells plate rows numeric denoting number rows plate cols numeric denoting number cols plate

text: Plate constructor

code: Plate(layers = list(), wells = NULL, meta = NULL)

title: Plate constructor — Plate
text: layers matrix dataframe, list matrices/dataframes wells optional numeric number wells plate contains. Useful instantiating plate without layers. Must match layer dimensions, provided. meta optional named list whole-plate descriptors

text: Plate object

title: Make a gp object — gp
text: Make gp object

title: Make a gp object — gp
code: gp(rows = NULL, cols = NULL, wells = NULL)

title: Make a gp object — gp
text: rows

title: Make a gp object — gp
text: gp object

title: Make a gp object — gp
text: gp object following components: nrow/ncol: Number plate rows/cols. static changed adding layers. wells: Number plate wells. Static. wells_sec: Number wells given section. creating plate, section refers whole plate. wells_sec_par: Number wells section parent layer. creating plate, parent layer, plate acts parent. well_data: Somewhat transient data used define plotting coordinates layers. See information. nrow_sec/ncols_sec: number rows/cols current section. creating plate, number number rows/cols plate (plate section). nrow_sec_par/ncol_sec_par: number rows/cols parent section. creating plate, parent, defaults parent. well_data consists many columns. variable names can broken follows: row/col: row always y axis, col always x axis. convention, plates start 1, 1 top left corner. sec: Short 'section'. section rectangular field wells. sec alone refers number section . sec combined row col (eg row_sec) refers coordinates given well relative section corners, top left corner given section always (1, 1). rel: Short 'relative'. means numbering relative starting_corner argument used create given section. instance, section created starting_corner br (bottom right) row_sec_rel col_sec_rel 1 bottom right corners. column labelled row_rel example refer bottom right plate 1, necessarily bottom right section. par: Short 'parent'. columns data previous layer. lane: specify (usually) multiwell strips defined one direction. lane_h lane_v tandem checkerboard-like patterns, intersection section. bit complicated wrap = TRUE, simile hold cases. col/row_rel_child_sec_par: odd columns. represent axes parental sections, using child's relative coordinate system. example, parent defined sections starting upper left, child defined sections starting upper right, col_rel_child_sec_par reversed col_sec_par_rel, row_rel_child_sec_par identical row_sec_par_rel

title: Make a gp object — gp
code: # If you specify wells, rows and columns are derived from a standard plate sizes:  gp(wells = 96) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘tidyr’  # As such, you cannot use the wells argument if you want to create more exotic plates:  try(gp(wells = 102)) #> Error in gp(wells = 102) :  #>   wells is not of a known format (6, 12, 24, 48, 96, 384, 1536, or 3456)  # For that, you'll need to specify wells and cols:  gp(rows = 6, cols = 17) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘tidyr’

what: Add a section to a gp object. — gp_sec
title: Add a section to a gp object. — gp_sec
text: Add section gp object.

title: Add a section to a gp object. — gp_sec
code: gp_sec(   gp,   name,   nrow = NULL,   ncol = NULL,   start_corner = c("tl", "tr", "bl", "br"),   flow = c("row", "col"),   padding = 0,   margin = 0,   wrap = FALSE )

title: Add a section to a gp object. — gp_sec
text: gp gp object name Character. Name section. nrow Numeric. Section height. NULL, fill width parent section. ncol Numeric. Section width. NULL, fill width parent section. start_corner Corner section place first item. flow Direction subsequent items placed relative first corner. padding Border width INSIDE section unfilled. Can take argument one (border around), two (top/bottom, left/right), three (top, left/right, bottom), four (top, right, bottom, left). margin Border width OUTSIDE section remain unfilled. See possible argument lengths. break_sections section need wrapped around edge parent section (default parent section plate), instead shift flow direction far enough can fit without wrapping? error either nrow ncol exceeds parent dimension.
